description: name of location where sampled
latitude of location where sampled (-90 to 90 deg South to North)
longitude of location where sampled (-180 to 180 West to East)

vegetation type where sampled if grown in field (leave blank for plantations / glasshouse / common garden): Sav = Savannah; TropRF = Tropical rainforest; TempRF = Temperate rainforest; TropSF = Tropical seasonal forest; TempF = Temperate forest; BorF = Boreal forest; Wo = Woodland; Gr = Grassland; Sh = Shrubland; De = Desert
mean annual rainfall (wild grown plants only)
mean annual temperature (wild grown plants only)
any information about growing environment of sampled plant such as treatment or subplot
leaf area index of vegetation (wild plants only)
latin name of species (genus species)
family
plant functional type: EA = evergreen angiosperm; DA = deciduous angiosperm; EG = evergreen gymnosperm; DG = deciduous gymnosperm
growing environment of sampled plant: FW = field wild; FE =field experimental; GH = glasshouse; PU = plantation unmanaged; PM = plantation managed; GC = growth chamber; CG = common garden
position in forest canopy (wild grown plants only): 0 = supressed; 1 = intermediate; 2 = codominant (crown partly exposed); 3 = dominant (crown fully exposed)
note any information about light environment of sampled plant; we will determine appropriate categories once we see what information is available
age of plant expressed as decimal -> e.g. 3months = 0.25years
leaf area of whole plant
area of sapwood cross section at base
area of sapwood cross section at breast height
area of sapwood cross section at base of crown
area of heartwood cross section at base
area of heartwood cross section at breast height
area of heartwood cross section at base of crown
area of bark cross section at base
area of bark cross section at breast height
area of bark cross section at base of crown
area of total stem cross-section at base of the plant
area of total stem cross-section at breast height
area of total stem cross-section at base of the crown
projected crown area as seen from above
surface area of whole crown
total height of plant from ground to highest leaf
height to crown base
diameter of stem at base
diameter of stem at breast height (~1.35cm)
height at which diameter at breast height (d.bh) is measured
diameter or width of crown
crown depth
leaf mass
sapwood mass including branches
heartwood mass including branches
bark mass including branches
mass of all stem tissue including branches (=m.ss + m.sh + m.sb)
mass of all above-ground structures (=m.lf + m.st)
branch mass
fine root mass
coarse root mass
total root mass (=m.rf+m.rc)
total mass (=m.rt+m.so)
leaf size (average area of individual leaves across entire plant)
leaf mass per area (average across entire plant or sample taken from top of plant; = m.lf/a.lf)
average density of all stem tissue (wood density)
density of stem sapwood
density of stem bark
density of stem heartwood
leaf nitrogen (average across entire plant or sample taken from top of plant)
nitrogen content of sapwood
nitrogen content of bark
nitrogen content of heartwood
nitrogen content of fine roots
nitrogen content of coarse roots
